SPANISH: pierna (especificar de dónde a dónde la llaman así)
ENGLISH: leg (specify from where to where they called it like this)

SPANISH: animal (ver si hay differencia entre animal pequeño o grande, doméstico o salvaje)
ENGLISH: Animal (see if there is differented between small or large, domestic or wild animal)

SPANISH: guajolote (si además distiguen por tamaño y sexo, anotar enfrente)
ENGLISH: Guajolote (if they also distribute by size and sex, write down in front)

SPANISH: mi pulque (si usan la palabra puluque, preguntar 'aguamiel')
ENGLISH: My pulque (if they use the word puluque, ask 'Aguamiel')

SPANISH: olla (averiguar si hay más de una clase y en qué se diferencían)
ENGLISH: pot (find out if there is more than one class and how they differentiated)

SPANISH: batea (la que se usa para la masa)
ropa (cualquiera que sea la forma obtenida preguntar si hay otra(s))
ENGLISH: Clothing (whatever the manner obtained ask if there is another (s))

SPANISH: redondo (cualquier palabra que se obtenga preguntar si hay otra)
ENGLISH: round (any word that is obtained by asking if there is another)

SPANISH: borracho (winti, tlawanki: cualquiera que den, preguntar la otra)
ENGLISH: Drunk (Winti, Tlawanki: Anyone to ask, ask the other)

SPANISH: tarde ('que ya no hay tiempo suficiente')
ENGLISH: afternoon ('that there is no enough time')

SPANISH: ¡bebe! (preguntar si hay diferencia entre beber agua y beber licor)
ENGLISH: baby! (Ask if there is a difference between drinking water and drinking liquor)

SPANISH: tekitika / tekipanoka (preguntese la forma según la dada en 299)
ENGLISH: Tekitika / Tekipanoka (Ask the form according to the one given in 299)
get it on! (a kid to the table)
They will take it up (a sack)
I broked it (a lot of something)

SPANISH: brilla (un metal al darle el sol)
ENGLISH: shines (a metal when the sun gives it)
